title: Pause in U.S. Weapons Deepens Ukrainian Concerns as Russian Attacks Grow
description: The suspension includes air defense interceptors, and it will directly affect Ukraine’s ability to fend off escalating Russian air assaults.

title: Israel Wants to Resume Truce Talks With Hamas Soon
description: Gideon Saar, the Israeli foreign minister, cited “positive signs” in the long-moribund cease-fire talks to end the war in Gaza and free the hostages held there.

title: Dalai Lama Tightens Grip on Reins of Succession in the Face of Chinese Pressure
description: The aging spiritual leader is looking to prevent Beijing from taking advantage of a power vacuum. But there is pressure to preserve a core element of Tibetan Buddhism.

title: Pound Drops Amid Uncertainty Over UK Chancellor Rachel Reeves
description: Rachel Reeves, Britain’s chancellor, appeared visibly upset in Parliament as the prime minister was asked about her position. The British pound and government bonds dropped in value.

title: What to Know About the Dangerous Heat in Europe
description: Weather agencies have warned of a third day of high temperatures that in some places have climbed well above 100 degrees Fahrenheit, or more than 40 degrees Celsius.

title: Argentina’s President Javier Milei Undermines Press Freedom With Online Attacks
description: Journalists face an increasing number of attacks from Argentina’s highest office, raising concerns about the undermining of press freedom.

title: Trump Says U.S. Has Reached Trade Deal With Vietnam
description: The president said he had agreed to initial trade terms with Vietnam, the second country to strike a limited deal after Mr. Trump threatened steep tariffs.

title: Russia-Azerbaijan Tensions Soar, Threatening Moscow’s Influence
description: The rift, provoked by the deaths of two ethnic Azerbaijanis in Russian custody, was the latest in a series of spats that revealed a deeper diplomatic rift between the former allies.

title: Kim Jong-un Appears to Mourn His Troops Killed Fighting for Russia
description: Through an event shown on North Korean state television, Mr. Kim also highlighted the sacrifices made for Moscow and the rewards he seeks.

title: Dalai Lama Succession: How the Next Tibetan Spiritual Leader Will Be Chosen
description: The Tibetan spiritual leader said that his lineage would continue, and that China would have no say about his successor.

title: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra Suspended Amid Cambodia Dispute
description: Paetongtarn Shinawatra is accused of ethical lapses in a conversation with the Cambodian leader Hun Sen and has faced calls to resign.

title: The First Income Tax in the Persian Gulf Signals a Changing Economic Reality
description: A plan by Oman is being closely watched by other governments in the region that are preparing for a future beyond oil.

title: Iran Suspends Cooperation With U.N. Nuclear Watchdog
description: The decision means that international inspectors will not be able to oversee sites. Experts have warned that Tehran could revive plans to build a bomb.

title: Heathrow Shutdown Caused by Problem Left Unfixed for Years, Report Says
description: The fire at an electrical substation was caused by a short circuit in a part that hadn’t been properly maintained by National Grid, an official report found.

title: How to Stay Cool While Traveling in Paris, Italy, Spain and Parts of Europe
description: As Europe buckles under a punishing heat wave, residents and summer travelers are struggling to find relief. Here’s how and where to look for respite.

title: Explosion at pharmaceutical factory in southern India kills at least 40
description: The death toll is expected to rise as authorities search the rubble of a Sigachi Industries plant in the Indian state of Telangana.

title: U.S. pauses some Ukraine weapons shipments; Kyiv scrambles to respond
description: Russia, which has been sending massive waves of drones and missiles against Ukraine, said the U.S. move would help end the war early.

title: Penguin turns up on beach in Rio de Janeiro, alone and far from home
description: Video shows a wayward penguin swimming and diving among beachgoers along Brazil’s most iconic shoreline. It might be following fish, a penguin expert says.

title: Trump’s bill ends tax on tips. Here’s how other countries tax them.
description: The U.S. is an outlier on tips. President Donald Trump’s tax bill would allow workers to deduct them from federal taxes.

title: Rare ‘roll cloud’ delights Portuguese beachgoers amid record heat wave
description: The dark, tsunami-like cloud formation billowed across parts of Portugal’s northern and central coasts, as the country set a heat record.

title: Judge blocks Trump from ending temporary protected status for Haitians
description: A federal judge ruled the Trump administration could not cut short the protection for migrants from Haiti, which has been under a state of emergency since March 2024.

title: European heat wave closes Eiffel Tower’s top floor and bakes Wimbledon
description: The heat wave that has blanketed much of Europe is expected to linger over the continent this week, driving up temperatures and offering little reprieve.

title: Dalai Lama lays out succession plan, denying Chinese efforts at control
description: The Tibetan Buddhist leader, who turns 90 on Sunday, appears concerned that Beijing will sweep in after his death to install the next Dalai Lama.

title: Column | As U.S. retreats, the world fights an uphill battle against inequality
description: “Financing is the engine of development. And right now, this engine is sputtering,” U.N. Secretary General António Guterres said at a global poverty conference in Seville.

title: Tests urged for 1,200 children after day care worker is charged with assault
description: Australian police said the man had worked at 20 child care centers in Melbourne or the wider state of Victoria and now faces sexual assault charges related to eight victims.

title: U.S. revokes visas for British band that chanted, ‘Death, death to the IDF’
description: British rap duo Bob Vylan’s lead singer, Bobby Vylan, made the remarks at the Glastonbury music festival, an annual event well known for political activism.

title: Iranian authorities make sweeping arrests in wake of war with Israel
description: The arrests have raised fears that a new wave of repression is coming, as the government seeks to root out spy networks and clamp down on any dissent.

title: North Korea’s Kim Jong Un shown with coffins of his soldiers killed in Russia
description: Kim paid public tribute to North Korean soldiers killed in Russia’s war against Ukraine, part of an effort to cement the two countries’ strategic defense pact.

title: Avoiding your boss? In Japan, you can hire someone to quit your job for you.
description: Japanese companies’ rigid hierarchies can make it hard to confront bosses. Enter “proxy quitters.”

title: USAID cuts may cause 14 million more deaths in next five years, study says
description: The analysis, published in the Lancet, estimates the agency’s programs saved 91 million lives worldwide over two decades, playing a vital role in global health.

title: 'Diddy' denied bail after being cleared of most serious charges
description: Combs will remain behind bars because of his history of violence, the judge said, setting sentencing for October.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs: Secret world revealed in voice notes and videos
description: Former staff expose details of "freak-offs" - drug-fuelled orgies held in luxurious international venues.

title: Jerome Powell: Trump calls for US central bank head to quit immediately
description: The president has repeatedly criticised Jerome Powell for not cutting rates but has sent mixed signals about removing him from the role.

title: Tibet is silent as Dalai Lama turns 90, BBC finds
description: The BBC speaks to Tibetans in Aba, which has long been at the heart of resistance to Chinese rule.

title: Gaza hospital director killed in Israeli strike, Hamas-run health ministry says
description: Dr Marwan Sultan was killed along with several family members in a strike on his home, the health ministry says.

title: Greece wildfires: mass evacuations as blaze rages near Ierapetra, Crete
description: People ordered to leave homes, hotels, and rental rooms in the nearby Ferma municipality as flames fanned by gale force-winds approach the area.

title: Trump says Israel has agreed to conditions for 60-day Gaza ceasefire
description: A Hamas official tells the BBC the group is "ready" for a deal if it ends the war, but optimism remains low.

title: Ukraine fears increased Russian aggression after US halt of weapons supply
description: On Tuesday the White House said that it had cut off some weapons deliveries to Ukraine in order "to put America's interests first".

title: Michelin-starred chef's lobster bisque and foie gras heading to space
description: A menu by French chef Anne-Sophie Pic will travel with astronaut Sophie Adenot to the ISS next year.

title: Ugandan military helicopter crashes at Somalia's Aden Adde airport in Mogadishu
description: Five people on board died, while three survived with "severe burns", the military said.

title: Ancient Egyptian history may be rewritten by a DNA bone test
description: A DNA bone test on a man who lived 4,500 years ago sheds new light on the rise of Ancient Egypt.

title: Mali attacks: Jihadist fighters launch coordinated raids on military posts
description: Tuesday's attack marks the third major assault on army positions over the past month.

title: Danish women to face conscription by lottery
description: The 18 year olds will join males in a lottery that could require them undergo a period of service.

title: Trump tightens US policy on Cuba
description: President Trump says a statutory ban on tourism to Cuba will be enforced more strictly.

title: Father jumps from Disney cruise to save child who fell overboard
description: Crew members were able to quickly rescue the pair, who were on the last day of a Disney cruise to the Bahamas.
